jx.jx_en_mean: moving to a higher (or lower) social class; acquiring (or losing) wealth and status
jx.jx_cn_mean: 向更高（或更低）社会阶层流动的；获得（或失去）财富和地位的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: via French from Latin mobilis, from movere 'to move'. The noun dates from the 1940s

entry.def: You use mobile to describe something large that can be moved easily from place to place.

example.ex: ...special mobile units where men can have their fingerprints taken and donate a specimen of blood.
example.tran: 人们可以取指纹和捐献血样的特设流动点

entry.tran: 走动方便的；行动自如的；出行方便的
entry.def: If you are mobile, you can move or travel easily from place to place, for example because you are not physically disabled or because you have your own transport.

entry.tran: (社会)流动性的;(在职业、住所或社会阶层间)自由流动的
entry.def: In a mobile society, people move easily from one job, home, or social class to another.

example.ex: We're a very mobile society, and people move after they get divorced.
example.tran: 我们的社会具有很大的流动性，离婚以后人们就会搬家离开。
流动性大的年轻专业人员

entry.def: If someone has a mobile face, the expression on their face changes quickly as their feelings change.

example.ex: Robyn had the more mobile, more expressive face.
example.tran: 罗宾有一张更加善变、表情更加丰富的脸。

entry.tran: (悬挂在天花板上的)风动小饰物
entry.def: A mobile is a decoration which you hang from a ceiling. It usually consists of several small objects which move as the air around them moves.
A mobile is the same as a mobile phone .

means.word_mean: 1. sculpture suspended in midair whose delicately balanced parts can be set in motion by air currents
1. moving or capable of moving readily (especially from place to place);
2. (of groups of people) tending to travel and change settlements frequently;

sentences.sentence: "believed the profession of a peregrine typist would have a happy future"

means.word_mean: 4. capable of changing quickly from one state or condition to another;

sentences.sentence: "Britain is not a truly fluid society"

Sentence.sentence: Experts see a movement toward the use of mobile technology in education, though they say it is in its infancy as professors try to come up with useful applications.

We think this is the way the future is going to work," said Kyle Dickson, co-director of research and the mobile learning initiative at Abilene Christian University in Texas, which has bought more than 600 iPhones and 300 iPods for students Although plenty of students take their laptops to class, they don't take them everywhere and would prefer something lighter
the wireless carrier offering the iPhone in the United States, had a more reliable network, said Andrew Yu, mobile devices platform project manager at M.I.T.

means.word_mean: 可迅速转动的, 易于移动的，非固定的，可移动的

sentences.en: The old lady sits on a mobile chair every morning.
sentences.cn: 那位老妇人每天上午坐在一把可携带使用的椅子上。

sentences.en: He has not been so mobile since his accident.
sentences.cn: 自从出事后他一直行动不便。

sentences.en: He converted his truck into a mobile snack bar.
sentences.cn: 他把货车改成流动小吃店。

sentences.en: She's much more mobile now that she's bought a car.
sentences.cn: 自从她买了汽车后, 活动量就大多了。

jushi.chinese: 他是一个脸部表情多变的演员。
